reference.text: producing ultra-high pressure or ultra-high pressure and high temperature to effect modifications of a substance, e.g. for making artificial diamonds B01J3/00
compressing means for refuse receptacles B65F1/1405

note.note-paragraph: This subclass provides for presses in general and also for those presses, for particular purposes, which are not provided for elsewhere.

title-part.text: Presses, using a press ram, characterised by the features of the drive therefor, pressure being transmitted directly, or through simple thrust or tension members only, to the press ram or platen

CPC-specific-text.text: by an elastic bag or diaphragm expanded by fluid pressure
by a scissor or lazy-tongs mechanism
using a fluid connection between the drive means and the press ram
by a rod swinging between a fixed plane and the ram

title-part.text: operated by cams, eccentrics, or cranks
operated by cams, eccentrics, or cranks

CPC-specific-text.text: the screw being directly driven by an electric motor
Braking mechanisms for the return movement of the press ram
driven by a continuously rotatable flywheel with a coupling arranged between the flywheel and the screw
using a fluid connecting unit between drive shaft and press ram
Drive systems for the cam, eccentric or crank axis
using a toggle connection between driveshaft and press ram

title-part.text: the cam, crank, or eccentric being disposed below the lower platen or table and operating to pull down the upper platen or slide
by the pull of chains or ropes

CPC-specific-text.text: using low pressure long stroke opening and closing means, and high pressure short stroke cylinder means
operated by hand or foot, e.g. using hydraulic jacks

title-part.text: involving a plurality of plungers acting on the platen
wherein the plungers are operated by pressure of a gas, e.g. steam, air
Presses characterised by the use of rotary pressing members, e.g. rollers, rings, discs
co-operating with one another, e.g. with co-operating cones
arranged one within another, e.g. with a roller disposed within a rotating ring and co-operating with the inner surface thereof
Presses characterised by the use of pressing means other than those mentioned in the preceding groups
wherein the pressing means is in the form of a flexible element, e.g. diaphragm, urged by fluid pressure
wherein the pressing means is in the form of an endless band

CPC-specific-text.text: using anti-friction means for the pressing band

title-part.text: Presses characterised by a particular arrangement of the pressing members
having several platens arranged one above the other
wherein pressing is effected in different directions simultaneously or in turn
Presses specially adapted for particular purposes
for squeezing-out liquid from liquid-containing material, e.g. juice from fruits, oil from oil-containing material

reference.text: kitchen equipment A47J; filtering, e.g. straining solids from liquids, using presses in combination with filtering elements B01D; expelling water from textile fabrics or laundry D06C, D06F; drying F26

CPC-specific-text.text: co-operating with casings mounted on a movable carrier, e.g. turntable

title-part.text: co-operating with permeable casings or strainers

CPC-specific-text.text: for making briquettes, e.g. from paper
with a retractable abutment member closing one end of the press chamber
using a press ram co-operating with an intermittently moved endless conveyer

title-part.text: using pressing worms or screws co-operating with a permeable casing

CPC-specific-text.text: Means preventing the material from turning with the screw or returning towards the feed hopper
using a rotatable and axially movable screw

title-part.text: operating with only one screw or worm
operating with two or more screws or worms

CPC-specific-text.text: the screws being coaxially disposed in the same chamber

title-part.text: with means for adjusting the outlet for the solid
using rotary pressing members, other than worms or screws, e.g. rollers, rings, discs

CPC-specific-text.text: using a roller with radially arranged vanes dividing the pressing space in separate chambers

title-part.text: using a flexible member, e.g. diaphragm,urged by fluid pressure

CPC-specific-text.text: co-operating with a drum or roller
comprising compartments which are recurrently constricted and expanded
The squeezing-out being performed in several stages
the edges of the band being folded over the material
The material being conveyed around a drum between pressing bands
Means for sealing the press zone
means disposed in the casing facilitating the squeezing-out of liquid

reference.text: from material in powder, granular, or paste form, e.g. briquetting presses B30B11/00
baling hay, straw, or the like A01F

CPC-specific-text.text: Extrusion chambers with adjustable outlet opening
Means for conditioning the material to be pressed, e.g. paper shredding means
Containers provided with, or connectable to, compacter means
Drive arrangements for the press ram
by the pull of chains or ropes
with press boxes on a movable carrier, e.g. turntable
with compression means other than rams performing a rectilinear movement
using a stationary press ram co-operating with a movable press box
with two or more stationary press boxes co-operating alternately with a press ram or simultaneously with press rams
the means against which, or wherein, the material is compacted being retractable

title-part.text: for consolidating scrap metal or for compacting used cars

CPC-specific-text.text: for consolidating empty containers, e.g. cans
between jaws pivoting with respect to each other
between rotary pressing members, e.g. rollers, discs
provided with shearing means for the scrap metal, or adapted to co-operate with a shearing machine

title-part.text: Presses specially adapted for forming shaped articles from material in particulate or plastic state, e.g. briquetting presses, tabletting presses

reference.text: for clay or mixtures containing cement B28B ; for plastics materials B29

CPC-specific-text.text: using a flexible element, e.g. diaphragm, urged by fluid pressure; Isostatic presses
Isostatic press chambers; Press stands therefor
using a roller with radially arranged vanes dividing the pressing space in separate chambers
involving the use of very high pressures,

reference.text: for the formation of artificial diamonds or boronitrides B01J3/065

CPC-specific-text.text: using a plurality of pressing members working in different directions
Applying a magnetic field to the material

title-part.text: using a ram exerting pressure on the material in a moulding space

CPC-specific-text.text: whereby the material is subjected to vibrations
whereby the material is transferred into the press chamber by relative movement between a ram and the press chamber

title-part.text: each charge of the material being compressed against the previously formed body
co-operating with moulds carried by a turntable
co-operating with moulds on the circumference of a rotating drum
co-operating with moulds on a movable carrier other than a turntable or a rotating drum
using pocketed rollers, e.g. two co-operating pocketed rollers
Roller-and-ring machines, i.e. with roller disposed within a ring and co-operating with the inner surface of the ring

CPC-specific-text.text: using an annular series of radial die cells, especially for crop material
Roller constructions; Mounting of the rollers

reference.text: extruding by the use of roller-and-ring machines B30B11/20

CPC-specific-text.text: using several circumferentially spaced rollers, e.g. skewed rollers
Means for dividing the extruded material into briquets
using pressing means, e.g. rollers moving over a perforated die plate
using two or more screws working in the same chamber
using two or more screws working in different chambers
Means preventing the material from turning with the screw or returning towards the feed hopper

title-part.text: Presses not provided for in groups B30B1/00 to B30B11/00
Methods of pressing not special to the use of presses of any one of the preceding main groups
Details of, or accessories for, presses
Auxiliary measures in connection with pressing

CPC-specific-text.text: Drive arrangements for movable carriers, e.g. turntables
means for adjusting the space between the press slide and the press table, i.e. the shut height
using an adjustable connection between the press drive means and the press slide
Counterbalancing means for movable press elements
Means for maintaining the press table, the press platen or the press ram against tilting or deflection
Dust eliminating means; Mould or press ram cleaning means
Moulds for compacting material in powder, granular of pasta form
Mounting of dies, platens or press rams
Loading or unloading of dies, platens or press rams
Means preventing deflexion of the frame, especially for C-frames

reference.text: with means for preventing deflection B30B15/044

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for equalizing the pressure exerted by a plurality of press rams
controlling the brake or the clutch
for stopping the press shaft in a predetermined angular position
for synchronising a line of presses

reference.text: pumps per se F04 ; hydraulic accumulators per se F15B ; valves per se F16K ; control devices in general G05

CPC-specific-text.text: controlling the ram speed and ram pressure, e.g. fast approach speed at low pressure, low pressing speed at high pressure

title-part.text: controlling the reciprocating motion of the ram

CPC-specific-text.text: Controlling the filling of the press cylinder during the approach stroke of the ram, e.g. prefill-valves
Controlling the return movement of the ram, e.g. decompression valves

title-part.text: controlling the speed of the ram, e.g. the speed of the approach, pressing or return strokes
controlling the degree of pressure applied by the ram during the pressing stroke
controlling the movement of a plurality of actuating members to maintain parallel movement of the platen or press beam

CPC-specific-text.text: using auxiliary cylinder and piston means as actuating members

title-part.text: Arrangements for preventing distortion of, or damage to, presses or parts thereof

CPC-specific-text.text: releasing fluid from a fluid chamber subjected to overload pressure
preventing a full press stroke if there is an obstruction in the working area
preventing unintended ram movement, e.g. using blocking devices
preventing over-run or reverse-run of the press shaft
Feeding material in particulate or plastic state to moulding presses
by using feed frames or shoes with relative movement

title-part.text: with regard to the mould or moulds

CPC-specific-text.text: in a continuous manner, e.g. for roller presses, screw extrusion presses

title-part.text: Heating or cooling presses or parts thereof
